page.title: 01N.W. Sutherland, Scotland
page.content: This area which is bordered by sea and by sea loch Eriholl, was cleared during the Highland Clearances and now has only two inhabited houses, Rispond Lodge and cottage. The land is acid, thin, badly drained with rocky outcrops. Grazing sheep have prevented regeneration of old woodland. There is only poor grazing for crofters North Coutry Cheviot sheep. Rispond Harbour (b) is used by lobster fishermen. Loch Eriboll is a deep and sheltered anchorge but is used only as occasional storm, holiday or naval anchorage. Ceannateinne beach (c) is popular with summer tourists. The old fishing village on Bagh Uamh Dhadhaidh (D) is long deserted and a few houses in ruins. The rocky island Cluimhrig (D) is inhabited only by seals and seabirds.
